...So, do you have a to-do list for KSP? What's on it?

I've not been KSPing for too long yet, so my "to-dos" are a bit more modest:

- I'd like to build a modular space station on-orbit. My first station was Salyut/MOL-inspired, and my second was Skylab-inspired; they've been nice but I want to get more ambitious. To that end, I had to work on developing my heavy-lift capability, which is what I've been concentrating on recently...

- I'd like to probe the other planets in the system. To date, I have brief partial scans of Moho, Eve, and Duna from flyby probes, and I have twice attempted to drop probes into Eve's atmosphere, so far to no avail. I have a pretty good idea of what I've done wrong so far, though (success is nice but failure is often a better teacher), so it's a TBD rather than a how-the-heck-do-I-do-it? item.

- Spaceplanes. I've been concentrating on the VAB and the launch pad; there's a whole 'nother aspect to KSP I've basically not touched yet.

Edited to Add: Another thing I'd like to do is mine older "paths not followed" in our own space program history, like early plans for Mars exploration in the 1970s and 80s, and try to make them work in KSP. There are some neat-looking design studies out there...

Look at this thread:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/116729-Stock-Payload-Fraction-Challenge-1-0-4-Edition

So far, nobody has done what you want, it may not be possible. They've gotten very close to 45%, but 50% is quite a leap.

make an SSTO that can land and refuel itself

Many have done this, it is quite feasible, at least going to low grav worls like minmus

make an SSTO with 5km/s of Delta V

make an SSTO with 6km/s of Delta V

Total, or in orbit?

I'm going to assume you don't count airbreathing deltaV.

This is easy enough if you're willing to use ion engines... otherwise....

Lets look at 5km/s dV in orbit... assuming you use Nukes.

5,000 m/s = 800s * 9.81 m/s/s * ln (mass ratio)

ln mass ratio = 0.6371

Mass ratio = 1.891

That means 47.1% of your craft must be fuel. This is harder than a SSTO with a payload of 45%, which has not been done. Since if 47.1% of your craft is fuel, then 53% will be fuel + tanks

Its much easier if its just closed cycle mode, and you get to count the dV you expend on rockets just reaching orbit...

Or if you are talking about the dV after a refuel once out of kerbin's atmosphere.

Establish a system-wide ore-based economy

Easy enough, just takes time.

ISRU can even be used on Eve, allowing you to land ascent vehicles, and then fill them up there.
